body.p:
Crab Orchard April 7th 62
To his Excellency
B Magoffin Gov of Ky
Dear Sir

about the 8th of Agust 1861, James Perkins was a Boy was arrested for carrying concealed deadly weapons & fined Fifty Dollars before S. E. Higgins a Justice of the peace for this Co some time the boy was unable to pay the fine and was about to be sent ^to^ Jail when H. E. Owsly endored for him some time afterwards a petition was sent to your Excelency praying that the same might be remited a Respite for 9 months ^was granted^ -- this day a fifa has been Issued against them for for Fifty four Dollars & 54 cnts & cost this money will have to be paid ^by^ Owsly (the Boy being insolvent) if not remited said H. E. Owsly has since that time been very unfortunate having been shot in the arm by one of the home Guards on account of Pollitiks. his arm was amputated above the elbo under all circumstances we believe him a suitable person for execuitve clemency
N B Pleas direct to me at this place
